description:
**Title:** Software Engineering Intern Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking several interns to work with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Cloud, DevSecOps, and Autonomous Systems techniques. **Must be a U.S. Citizen Internship dates: June 1st - August 20th, 2021** For each of the projects, interns will leverage the AWS machine learning tools, continue to advance KBR's knowledge and application of data analytics.

Interns will collaborate with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects such as the development of a Cloud Security Strategy to leverage the built-in capabilities provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS tools used will include CloudWatch, Inspector, Systems Manager, GuardDuty, Kibana, and QuickSight, with opportunities for the addition of custom tools for configuration management, training, and other elements to complete a robust Cloud-based security framework for KBR. The framework will include an end-to-end DevSecOps platform designed to automate security requirements by embedding security controls and processes early in the DevOps workflow, and will help our customers continue to develop and apply new technology capabilities while retaining systems security.

Additional projects will include investigating the value of Digital Twin (DT) in autonomous systems use cases; investigate setting up for the use cases and how the operational AI systems would interact with DT requirements. Explore methodology to address operational decision making utilizing machine learning in Air Traffic Management and other domains. Analyze textual information in transportation datasets to identify commonalities; demonstrate Natural Language Processing (NLP) capability.

Managing telematics data, implement ability to overlay multiple vehicle routes on a map to assess road utilization. Other projects will be similar to last year's summer internship program which consisted of: Reinforcement learning technique to enable autonomous systems and robotics. Research Explainable AI and leveraging this technology to detect bias in machine learning models.

Use distributed ledger/block-chain technology to enable governance and management of flight identifiers. Edge computing utilizing neuromorphic processing. Research and development of Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) software and hardware tools; develop an AR/VR solution to simulate real-world environments and facilitate activities such as remote maintenance of complex systems and virtual training environments.

Interns will spend the majority of their time researching, installing, and configuring new tools, programming using the selected tools, and learning more efficient methods to solve a given problem. Interns are not required to be programming experts, but they should have a passion for learning new things and not be afraid to jump in and try out new tools and/or solutions. Interns will leverage an Agile Development process with daily scrum meetings facilitated using Jira to capture user stories and track the status of all issues.

Fridays are reserved for documenting the work each week in the form of a Wiki site, as well as numerous forms of documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.). Once a month, interns will present the work they have completed to other staff members at KBR, with a final presentation at the end of the summer to both KBR and customer personnel. **Required Education:** + Must be enrolled in undergraduate coursework in a related degree program at an accredited university + Must be a Rising Junior or Senior **Preferred:** + Basic familiarity with virtual environments and cloud-based technologies, as well as programming languages such as Java, Python, Perl etc.

Work Schedule: Estimated at 32-40 hours/week with flexibility to accommodate intern's education Work Location: Telework **Scheduled Weekly Hours:** 40 KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. KBR is a global provider of differentiated professional services and solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the government services and technology sectors.

KBR employs approximately 28,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in 40 countries. KBR is proud to work with customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long- term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. **At KBR, We Deliver.**

Title:

Software Engineering Intern

Around here, we define the future.

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking several interns to work with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Cloud, DevSecOps, and Autonomous Systems techniques.

Must be a U.S. Citizen Internship dates: June 1st - August 20th,2021

For each of the projects, interns will leverage the AWS machine learning tools, continue to advance KBR's knowledge and application of data analytics. Interns will collaborate with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects such as the development of a Cloud Security Strategy to leverage the built-in capabilities provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS tools used will include CloudWatch,Inspector, Systems Manager, GuardDuty, Kibana, and QuickSight, with opportunities for the addition of custom tools for configuration management, training, and other elements to complete a robust Cloud-based security framework forKBR.The frameworkwill include an end-to-end DevSecOps platform designed to automate security requirements by embedding security controls and processes early in the DevOps workflow, and will help our customers continue to develop and apply new technology capabilities while retaining systems security.

Additional projects will include investigating the value of Digital Twin (DT) in autonomous systems use cases; investigate setting up for the use cases and how the operational AI systems would interact with DT requirements. Explore methodology to address operational decision making utilizing machine learning in Air Traffic Management and other domains. Analyze textual information in transportation datasets to identify commonalities; demonstrate Natural Language Processing (NLP) capability. Managing telematics data, implement ability to overlay multiple vehicle routes on a map to assess road utilization.

Other projects will be similar to last year's summer internship program which consisted of: Reinforcement learning technique to enableautonomous systemsand robotics. Research Explainable AI and leveraging this technology to detect bias in machine learning models. Use distributed ledger/block-chain technology to enable governance and management of flight identifiers. Edge computing utilizing neuromorphic processing. Research and development of Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) software and hardware tools; develop an AR/VR solution to simulate real-world environments and facilitate activities such as remote maintenance of complex systems and virtual training environments.

Interns will spend the majority of their time researching, installing, and configuring new tools, programming using the selected tools, and learning more efficient methods to solve a given problem. Interns are not required to be programming experts, but they should have a passion for learning new things and not be afraid to jump in and try out new tools and/or solutions.

Interns will leverage an Agile Development process with daily scrum meetings facilitated using Jira to capture user stories and track the status of all issues. Fridays are reserved for documenting the work each week in the form of a Wiki site, as well as numerous forms of documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.). Once a month, interns will present the work they have completed to other staff members atKBR, with a final presentation at the end of the summer to both KBR and customer personnel.

Required Education:

  • Must be enrolled in undergraduate coursework in a related degree program at an accredited university

  • Must be a Rising Junior or Senior

Preferred:

  • Basic familiarity with virtual environments and cloud-based technologies, as well as programming languages such as Java, Python, Perl etc.

Work Schedule: Estimated at 32-40 hours/week with flexibility to accommodate intern's education

Work Location: Telework

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Interns will spend the majority of their time researching, installing, and configuring new tools, programming using the selected tools, and learning more efficient methods to solve a given problem. Interns are not required to be programming experts, but they should have a passion for learning new things and not be afraid to jump in and try out new tools and/or solutions.

Interns will leverage an Agile Development process with daily scrum meetings facilitated using Jira to capture user stories and track the status of all issues. Fridays are reserved for documenting the work each week in the form of a Wiki site, as well as numerous forms of documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.). Once a month, interns will present the work they have completed to other staff members atKBR, with a final presentation at the end of the summer to both KBR and customer personnel.

Required Education:

  • Must be enrolled in undergraduate coursework in a related degree program at an accredited university

  • Must be a Rising Junior or Senior

Preferred:

  • Basic familiarity with virtual environments and cloud-based technologies, as well as programming languages such as Java, Python, Perl etc.

Work Schedule: Estimated at 32-40 hours/week with flexibility to accommodate intern's education

Work Location: Telework

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

Learn More About Internship Programs at CommScope

As CommScope designs and builds connectivity for the world's most advanced networks, we're building something equally as important: careers for forward-thinking college students like you. Our Summer Internship Program is designed to provide you an invaluable work experience through completing meaningful projects to help you grow and develop.

Throughout the 12-week program, you will collaborate with some of the best in the industry, receive on the job training and participate in professional development workshops, executive speaker series, and other networking and social events!

 

What to Expect:

As a Software Engineering Intern to design testing procedures for our software applications. In this role, will be responsible for analyzing the functionality of applications and designing automated tests to validate their performance. You will also be required to identify bugs, install databases, and collaborate with the software design team. To ensure success as a Softwaer Engineering Intern, you should have advanced programming skills, a keen eye for detail, and excellent project management skills. A skilled QA Automation Engineer can design and write efficient test procedures for every software application.

 

You Will Make an Impact By:
  • Meeting with the software design team to discuss verification protocols.
  • Identifying software application weaknesses and target areas.
  • Sketching out ideas for automated software test procedures.
  • Reviewing software bug reports and highlighting problem areas.
  • Writing automation scripts and implementing software applications.
  • Designing and installing software databases.
  • Troubleshooting automation software and finalizing system procedures.
  • Identifying quality issues and creating test reports.
  • Collaborating with the design team to solve application faults.
  Required Qualifications for Consideration
  • Junior or Senior standing in a BS, BA or master's degree in (specified field/area) from an accredited university
  • Proven strong academic performer with a minimum GPA of 3.2
  • Eligible to work in the US for any employer without sponsorship from the company
  • Advanced programming skills including automation systems and databases.
  • Familiarity with programming languages including Java, C, C++, Python
  • Excellent analytical skills.
  • Detailed knowledge of application functions, bug fixing, and testing protocols.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Good project management skills.
  You Will Excite Us If You
  • Enter any preferred qualifications
  • Demonstrate strong leadership, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Show innovation through unique ideas and propose them to the team

Why CommScope?

In today's always on world, CommScope is pushing the bounds of communications technology. We are building better connections and shaping networks of the future. For more than 40 years, we've been leaders in innovating the network infrastructure of the future. Developments such as the Internet of Things, seamless connectivity and 5G introduce new requirements and demand creative thinking. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.

It is the policy of CommScope to provide Equal Employment Opportunities to all individuals based on merit, qualifications and abilities. CommScope does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy), national origin, age or any other characteristics as protected by law. Furthermore, this contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals on the basis of disability, and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals with disabilities.

Apply now

Sigma is SaaS that democratizes decision making using data. We offer an application that lets users who are skilled in spreadsheet usage analyze mass amounts of data in their large data warehouse. This unlocks decision making across companies, letting people who aren't data scientists accelerate their work.

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • How to build production software.
  • How large Single Page Applications are built and extended.
  • How backend scales to handle multiple customers and billions of data points while keeping the information secure.
  • How to own a project beginning to end.

We are an inclusive team of software engineers who complement each other's skills to inspire and design solutions that power the Sigma product experience. As an intern on this team, you will have the opportunity to experiment, prototype and implement user visible features that help our customers analyze and gather insights from their data. During the 12 week internship period, you will be paired with a mentor and collaborate with other team members, develop designs and implement a chosen solution, deploy and gather insights from customer metrics.

During your internship, you will

  • Partner with product managers, designers and other engineers
  • Design & deliver innovative solutions to improve the Sigma user experience by implementing new features.
  • Find innovative ways to optimize the performance of one or more components of the product.
  • Develop automated unit tests to get the relevant code coverage and work with product owners and techpubs to document your work.

We expect the following for you to be successful 

  • You must be pursuing at least a Bachelor's or a Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Have a solid grasp of Operating Systems, Data structures, algorithms and at least one modern programming language such as Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.
  • Eager to learn and build complex user interfaces, data visualizations, or backend systems.
  • Have a drive and desire to navigate unknowns, after all that's what unlocks realizations.
  • Ability to collaborate and work in a team environment.

If you do not feel that you satisfy all the listed requirements, we encourage you to still apply. We are enthusiastically looking for people that will help us grow our company and sometimes we are imperfect communicators and can't articulate perfectly what experience is required for a role. We are looking for people that are excited to grow and constantly ask how we can do things better. If you are excited about the opportunity, we encourage you to apply even if you don't satisfy 100% of the job requirements.

Our Benefits:

  • $40/hour, 40 hours per week 
  • Flexible schedule, do the work you need to get done in the time you have to get it done
  • Opportunities to interact with Sigma leaders, build your network, and learn about the business.
  • Fun team events throughout your internship!

What's next: 

To get started, submit your application through our job posting. We review the resumes quickly that we receive but sometimes there are a lot of applications so please be sure that the relevant information on your resume stands out.

Every interview process might be a slightly different but generally you can expect the process to look like this: 

  • We expect the entire process to take no more than 2 weeks depending on your availability
  • A phone screen with someone on our hiring team
  • An "in person" interview (likely on zoom these days) with a number of people you will be working with closely to assess your technical skills as well as what you will bring to build on our culture
  • A zoom interview with the hiring manager

At Sigma, we believe every person has unique domain expertise that they bring to the table. Our mission is to give everyone the technical abilities to leverage their expertise to drive their business decisions. This idea is fundamental to who we are and how we collaborate and treat each other. We believe we are Smarter Together and what each person brings to the table helps make us (and our company) stronger.  How we do this internally is through transparency and Fearless Communication. We explain, we speak up, and we all have the opportunity to contribute to the company. With that communication, we Assume Best Intent and know what how we approach each other and our customers is with a common goal. We are Curious & Constructive in looking at how we can make our product, company, and community better. With all of these Company Values, we Aim for Greatness, we have big goals that we keep hitting and we continue to reassess how we can set those goals even higher. Come join us to help us be smarter and grow together!

We are committed to building a smart and strong team regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We look forward to learning how your experience can enable all of us to grow.

About the Position

What are you looking for in a Summer Internship?

Do you want to make a difference in society and learn new skills at the same time?  Do you want to be a valued member of a team and more than an employee number? Do you enjoy innovating and participating in hackathons?

For over 30 years, United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) has managed the nation's organ transplant system.  We manage the "Wait List" for those who are waiting to receive a life-saving organ (or, as we call it, the "gift of life").  We create and implement the nation's transplant policies and ensure patient safety standards are met.  We educate the nation's transplant healthcare providers and support patients and their families.  Our 350+ person team is located in Richmond, Virginia and about one-third of our employees work in IT. 

We are offering two (2) 12-week Summer Internship positions for Summer 2021 supporting our IT Departments.  All students will be assigned a mentor, have structured orientation, and be placed directly on one of our software engineering teams.

        Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position

        Students will work 36-40 hours a week and will receive fair compensation

IT Software Engineer (2 positions)

We have eight agile teams (Team Kraken, Iron Fish, Iron Dragon, Team Carna, etc.) with various levels of software engineers (Associate to Senior) and automation testers on each team.  Interns will work with their assigned team to perform technical analysis, software design, and software testing with high quality deliverables that may go into final product releases. Students will participate in writing technical documentation as necessary by the UNOS Development Methodology and Standards, incorporate innovative ideas and approaches to software development.

Students will learn to:

        Write API, application, and database code based on business requirements or user stories, architectural requirements, and established coding standards.

        Participate in peer code reviews.

        Validate code against business and architectural requirements.

        Perform API and application system testing.

        Participate in reviews of business epics and stories.

        Troubleshoot applications and resolve defects.

        Communicate ideas in both technical and user friendly language.

        Update and maintain product documentation.

        Escalate issues and impediments in a timely manner.

        Work within established frameworks and processes.

Qualified students for this opportunity should have:

        An understanding of software design and development principles gained from course work or experience with coding in object oriented programming language.

        Possess knowledge of team-oriented and collaborative working environments.

Minimum Requirements for all listed internships

Entry level IT, software development, information security, or other related experience.

Education

This position requires the individual to be working towards a degree in Computer Science or related field of study.

Physical Requirements

General office demands

About Us

The United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) coordinates the nation's organ transplant system, providing vital services to meet the needs of men, women and children awaiting lifesaving organ transplants. Based in Richmond, Va., UNOS is a private, nonprofit membership organization.
UNOS members encompass every transplant hospital, tissue matching laboratory and organ procurement organization in the United States, as well as voluntary health and professional societies, ethicists, transplant patients and organ donor advocates.

Top workplace in Richmond since 2013

UNOS is a great place to work! We're one of only a few organizations to be named a top work place in Richmond by the Richmond Times Dispatch for 6 years in a row.

Virginia Values Veterans Certified

UNOS is V3-certified! V3- Certified companies work with the Department of Veterans Services and other strategic partners to support Virginia's Veterans.

Pearson VUE (www.pearsonvue.com) is the global leader in computer-based testing for information technology, academic, government and professional testing programs around the world. Pearson VUE provides a full suite of services from test development to data management, and delivers exams through the world's most comprehensive and secure network of test centers in more than 180 countries, where we validate the skills and knowledge of millions of individuals every year.

Pearson VUE is a business of Pearson, the world's leading learning company with global-reach and market-leading businesses. Pearson is listed on both the London and New York stock exchanges (UK: PSON; NYSE: PSO). 

  The Software Engineering Intern is responsible for analysis, design, implementation, unit and functional testing of integrated software products.  The goal is to produce high quality code for a technology organization that is responsible for applications that manage the end to end testing experience, from registration and payments, to test construction and delivery, thru result and business reporting and intelligence.  To do so, you will have an opportunity to use industry best practices while working in a team of high-performing professionals.  

 

Please note there are two separate Software Development internships at Pearson, this one (focused on making things and making sure they are right), and the Software Development Engineer in Test (focused on breaking things and making sure they are right), apply to the one that is the best fit for your interests and personality bent.  This one involves more hands-on programming than the other one but does not include as much testing focus particularly at the functional level.

You will have the chance to experience "life in the POD", such as it is now with much remote work, and build skills in using programming languages, advanced testing techniques, and agile development methodology.   As part of the software engineering internship, you will partner with a technology mentor to help you continue to grow, learn, and contribute.

This internship also has an Engineering focus where you'll have an opportunity to participate in Panel Discussions (Leadership & Former Interns), learn more about our broader organization by being exposed to "Day in the Life of" job overviews, and engage in all-intern social events.

The Intern will:

  • Participate in team activities like backlog grooming, sprint planning, daily stand-up, retrospectives, and reviews
  • Execute coding and testing tasks for agile stories as part of an agile development team
  • Identify, document, and resolve defects as part of our validation process
  • Other duties as assigned by managers or leads

Required Education & Experience:

  • Completion of at least Sophomore level coursework (Junior level preferred) leading towards a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, or closely related field
  • Familiarity with at least one programming language (Java preferred)

Desired Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:

  • Desire to learn and expand knowledge in development languages, applications, and tools
  • Intellectual horsepower and proven ability to quickly learn new processes and tools, business domains and technical applications
  • Strong Written and Verbal skills to communicate with clarity and brevity to other professionals.

Remote from anywhere in the US

Cohesity is the industry leader taking modernized approach to solving Mass Data Fragmentation.

Simplifying all data and applications in the public cloud and the edge.

Video How Cohesity Redefines Data Management 

As a Software Engineering Intern, You will be working along side one of the best software engineering teams in the Valley.  Voted Forbes top 40 hottest startups, you will be working on cutting edge distributed systems technology and building product features that customers will use.   We are looking for technically strong and motivated individuals to join our team.  You will learn how to develop high quality software and understand the various software development processes to ship successful products.

Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • Interest in complex distributed systems
  • Motivated to improve software quality
  • Proficient in C, C++, Golang, Python or AngularJS
  • Willing to learn, have fun, and make an impact!

Job Description:

Cohesity is hiring Software Engineering interns to develop and test software features. 

Engineering internships at Cohesity are usually 12 weeks.   During your internship, you will work alongside your mentor and your team to build product features and solve real problems.  

WIIFM (What's in it for me?)

  • As a Software Engineering Intern, you will be exposed to cutting edge technologies in distributed systems and hyper-converged systems space.
  • You will learn from world class engineering team members that bring previous experience in building web-scale distributed systems
  • Be part of our culture and mission in transforming Data
  • Add value to your resume with one of the hottest startups in Silicon Valley backed by top investors in the industry. Voted as Forbes top 40 hottest startups and Bay Area Top Employer.

Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related engineering field at accredited university
  • Experience or interest working on distributed systems
  • Strong programming skills in any: C, C++, or Go and OOP
  • Competent  in Data Structure, Algorithms and Systems Design
  • Experience working with some of the following: Unix/Linux environments, distributed or  parallel systems, machine learning, asynchronous programming, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development.
  • Enjoy solving difficult problems and possess critical thinking abilities.
  • Coachable, motivated, and humble
  • Ability to demonstrate his/her own projects and achievements
  • Willing to take on difficult problems with a positive attitude.

Org Marketing Statement

With annual sales of $14.3 billion in fiscal year 2019, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 50 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index.

Position Summary

We have two internship openings. As a member of the Internet of Things (IoT) team, the Software Engineering Intern will work with the IoT software engineering team and data analytics solution architects to collect data from products, develop algorithms to analyze time series data from these products, deploy those solutions to the edge and cloud to enable customers to take action to reduce downtime, improve performance and understand the status of their equipment. As a software engineer, the candidate will apply software development principles, agile methodology and data analytics to put information in a way that customers can understand. The responsibilities include development of user interfaces, data access APIs to interface between Parker components on machines to the cloud databases and test automation using up to date tools and technology in an edge and cloud environment.

Responsibilities

- Develop software for the IoT Azure based web portal - Develop software for the gateway that aggregates signal data and sends to Azure Cloud - Comply to engineering standards with the guidance of senior engineers - Interpret time series data from machines and components to enable customers to reduce downtime, optimize performance and utilization, and to streamline maintenance - Collaborate with product teams to identify key data sources and required sensing, acquisition and compute strategies to deploy those models into real-time edge systems or to the cloud - Develop, code, and deploy algorithms to interpret IoT data-either using big data tools for historical reporting or through time series machine learning for condition monitoring - Implement solutions that combine data from multiple sources into easy to understand alerts, reports and metrics - Able to integrate data to predict and prevent failures - Understand machine control data, interpret sensor data and build optimal control solutions

Qualifications

- Student pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, data analytics or equivalent bachelor's degree - Experience in one or more programming languages: Java, Javascript, C++, Python - Strong communication and team work skills - Experience using Jira a plus - Experience working in Azure or similar environment a plus - Experience in predictive modeling a plus - Experience or projects in AI, machine learning or deep learning a plus - Experience or projects in big data tools, such as Spark or Hadoop, a plus - Up to date technical knowledge of data science, including but not limited to: Data provisioning, cleaning, and normalization, large-scale data storage and retrieval, applied statistics a plus - Visualization techniques and tools, such as Power BI, to produce reports, dashboards, metrics, trend data - Positive attitude with passion for growth, can-do approach to obstacles - Able to work flexible hours, working with global development and deployment teams - Able to work in a flexible environment both remote and on site in Elk Grove Village as conditions require

Job Description

WE MAKE COMPUTERS THAT CAN SEE

Cognex is the global leader in the exciting and growing field of machine vision. With over $600 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment. Our employees, proudly called "Cognoids," take their work but not themselves seriously. Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance, and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment.

Portland's Engineering Center

We are a set of small, dynamic teams passionate about making machine vision easy. Our embedded systems are responsible for manufacturing and processing over a billion products a day. We are responsible for architecting, developing, and verifying firmware for our highly successful In-Sight and DataMan product lines. The team works closely with hardware development and application Engineering teams and customers across the company to deliver cutting edge products on a rapid development schedule.

Your role

Join one of our Portland engineering teams working on various software development projects, continuous integration and test projects, or dev-ops infrastructure projects. Assignments will be based on individual skill sets, areas of interest, and areas of need that Cognex has. Demonstrated skill and passion for software development may lead to more complex development assignments over the course of the internship.

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a bachelors or master's degree in computer science, electrical engineering, or other relevant technical discipline

Responsibilities

  • Work with engineers across the company to develop new products and services
  • Develop prototypes to prove out key design concepts and quantify technical constraints and prototypes
  • Take ownership of your contributions through unit testing, performance testing and writing documentation

Preferred skills and interest

  • Software development in C/C++ or C# and python, typescript or angular
  • Comfortable working with test hardware such as oscilloscopes and function generators
  • Experience with Arduino, Raspberry Pi, or other embedded platform development
  • Linux experience

Are you ready to get some hands-on experience with an amazing team? Sparklight is looking for a Software Engineering Intern for the summer session. As a Software Engineer Intern, you will spend 12 weeks learning and building software coded modules using Java and .NET. Our interns will have the opportunity to shadow Senior Software Developers and learn from their experience, in addition to working on projects individually. You will have our team's support every step of the way! 

Who is Sparklight?

At Sparklight - a Cable One company, we keep our customers and associates connected to what matters most. For our associates, that means: a thriving and rewarding career, respect for the communities where they live and work, a focus on health and wellness, an excellent work/life balance, and an open and inclusive workplace.

What you will do

  • Design, Build, Test and Deploy software coded modules and/or applications using Java or .Net programming languages
  • Apply logic when analyzing business processes to be automated via software code
  • Utilize GIT and/or TFS source control applications to maintain versioning of developed code modules
  • Develop database queries and stored procedures against MSSQL and Oracle RDMS
  • Actively participate in Agile Scrum development methodologies and ceremonies (including 2-week sprints, daily stand-ups, user-story creation, demos, retrospectives, etc.)
  • Analyze computer and application logs to troubleshoot system and application errors

Qualifications:

  • Enrolled in an associates or undergraduate degree program (preferably in Computer Science)
  • Experience working with MSSQL, Oracle RDMS, Java and .Net
  • Able to troubleshoot and think outside of the box
  • Excitement to learn and prepare yourself for your upcoming career!

What you will gain:

  • On the job training
  • A collaborative space to work with and interact with a team of experienced and talented software engineers
  • Experience in the day to day operations of a Software Engineer
  • Opportunities to discuss goals, career, and education in a one to one setting

Internship duration and schedule: 40 hours per week; 12 weeks.

Diversity lies in the communities we serve and among the associates who dedicate themselves to ensure our continued success. At Cable One and our family of companies, we believe it is our individual and unique talents, backgrounds, and perspectives that, when combined, truly make us an unstoppable force. "Stronger Together" is not just a verbal cue, it is the motto that our associates live by, exemplify and embody each and every day. Cable One provides equal employment opportunities to all individuals of different races, colors, creeds, national origins, genders, marital and veteran statuses.

Software Engineering Intern

  

Job Description:

   

At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You'll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a "reverse mentoring" program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

About the Company

Aruba, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise company, is a leader in providing enterprise-scale WLAN/edge networking products. Our customers include major universities, giant tech companies, and international retail stores, with deployments numbering thousands of access points and tens of thousands of wireless devices.

Aruba @ HPE is currently hiring Software Engineer Internsfor theSanta Clara, CAlocation. This will be with the Aruba organization within HPE. Anticipated start date isMay/June 2021.

Aruba is redefining the "IT EDGE". Creating new customer experiences by building intelligent digital workspaces. We are focused on campus, branch, mobility and the Internet of Things (IoT) to transform business models with the combined power of compute, context, control and secure connectivity.

We are looking for energetic, compassionate and sharp individuals who can adapt to a fast-paced environment for a jumpstart in a challenging career.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, code, document and test microservices in a cloud-based orchestration environment (Example: Kubernetes, Docker)
  • Integrate and use cloud-centric databases (Example: Cassandra, Postgres, ElasticSearch, Prometheus)
  • Employ cloud-oriented scalability techniques and messaging (Example: Kafka, RabbitMQ)
  • Design, develop, and test highly available, scalable, and distributed software systems in Cloud-based CI/CD development
  • Benchmark applications and service performance in a cloud-based environment
  • Develop solutions agnostic of specific Cloud platform (Example: AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
  • Collaborate with Embedded Switch Development teams to extend network switching management and analytics into the Cloud
  • Work in a fast moving Agile and DevOps product development environment

Requirements:

  • Must currently be enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related
  • Must be graduating AFTER May/June 2021 for summer internship
  • Familiarity with any modern cloud infrastructure or applications a big plus
  • Knowledgeable in GO, Java or Python or at least one high level language
  • Strong programming skills, a coding test will be part of the interview process

We offer:

A competitive salary and extensive social benefits

Diverse and dynamic work environment

Work-life balance and support for career development

If you have a passion to excel, curiosity, and the commitment to go the extra mile to solve the toughest business problems, we want you on our team. It takes a special person to work at Urban Science. We are much more than just computer geeks - we are analytical problem solvers on the move.

COMPANY: Urban Science is a business-solutions company focused on supporting the needs of the sales and marketing function of the automotive industry. We leverage a scientific methodology to help our client partners sell more vehicles, improve profitability and increase customer loyalty. And we do that by helping solve their toughest challenges including planning an optimal dealership network, improving individual dealer performance and efficiently converting sales leads into sales.

In short, we guide business through science-and we've been doing this since 1977. POSITION OVERVIEW: The Software Engineering Intern will support software design and implementation, which includes developing and testing features for future applications and supporting existing applications. These teams provide state-of-the-art proprietary solutions to our global clients utilizing cutting-edge technology.

+ Develop and test new functionality, with general supervision regarding methodology and approach. + Work in a team environment to create and verify web applications, interfaces, and web services that meet and exceed customer's needs and expectations. + Participate in application/solution design, code reviews and evaluation of the functionality against the client's needs (user stories).

+ Develop testing algorithms for validating functionality. + Create and review technical designs. + Participate in release planning by providing estimates and design input.

+ Support and continuously improve iterative software development processes and procedures. + Work towards target deadlines that are in accordance with the release dates. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND COMPETENCIES To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies required. Preferred familiarity with, or desire and ability to learn: + Web languages and tools such as HTML, CSS, JQuery, JavaScript and Bootstrap; + Languages such as C#, MVC5, ASP.NET, WCF, and SQL; + Tools such as Visual Studio (VS), Team Foundation Server (TFS); + Web service technology; + Unit, integration, and exploratory testing. Requires ability to: + Understand a situation by breaking it apart into smaller pieces, and/or tracing the implications of a situation in a step-by-step causal way.

+ Analyze requirements to determine how applications function to build effective designs and tests. + Learn and follow Urban Science's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). + Create and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues and/or customers.

Work cooperatively with others and be part of a team. + Develop business awareness and understanding of the business requirements of IT. + Behave in a trustworthy and transparent manner.

+ Monitor and check work deliverables ensuring high quality, accuracy and having a strong attention to detail. + Compose and verbally deliver information of varying levels. Communicate ideas, facts and data in writing.

+ Prioritize competing demands, manage multiple concurrent tasks and adapt to changing priorities. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE + Demonstrate experience with software development and testing methodologies, in an internship, collegiate, or Capstone project. + Currently pursuing a Baccalaureate degree in an appropriate IT field such as Computer Science or Computer Engineering from an accredited U.S.

college or university, equivalent foreign institution, or equivalent experience. + Microsoft certifications are a plus. WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This description is intended to describe the type and level of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is NOT an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by a person so classified.

The software team at Fluke Calibration is looking for a front end or full stack software developer intern to join one of our software teams delivering game changing solutions for our industry. If you are looking for an opportunity to learn how large-scale client-server projects are being developed in serverless architecture and want to roll up your sleeves to also help, then this might be the position for you.

We are looking for developer interns to join our team and contribute to our SAAS projects delivering Calibration and Thermal Imaging software platforms. We leverage AWS serverless infrastructure and React/Redux, Node and Python in our front and backends. Our teams function in an Agile development environment, and leverage our Fortive Business Systems toolkits in a rapid iteration release cycle.

    Contribute to our highly scalable React front-end integrated with our AWS micro-services stack
    Contribute towards internal tools for analytics, tracking, marketing and support
    Work with the Product and Test teams to help deliver on 2 week sprint cycles
 

  • Working towards a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent technical degree
  • For Front End devs: Some experience building web UI's utilizing React
  • For Full Stack devs: Some experience using Node for server side development
  • AWS knowledge is a huge plus
  • Ability to perform in an Agile team environment
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, both independently and in a team
